Nightshift looks at the flickering field, and taps a finger on the dashboar=
d of the computer.

" Now the only thing that could be do'n that has ta be =
some sorta electro magnetic disturbance....  Hey, could it be Tucson's Sona=
r system doing that?  As far as we know he still has sonar weaponry."

He s=
its up at the console.

" Computer, can you analyze and identify the source=
 of the energy disturbance?  Please check for similarities between those en=
ergy read outs and the configurations of those matching, Maximal/ former Au=
tobot Tucson who is now Tucson Prime."

He waits for the results.

" I hope=
 I'm right."

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for thin=
gs you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On =
Jan 18, 2012, at 12:25 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
=

h his paw digits

>=
 >
> > " I'm on it now sir, thanks for the code. Oh yeah, Computer, suspend=
 all
> > control on Cheetors ID, till further notice. I suspect he's been a=
ltered
> > against his will."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "Acknowledged.' The computer =
said. "Cheetor's identification profile
> has been suspended."
> 
> Meanwhi=
le on one of the display panels the jungle was displayed,
> however this ti=
me it was a real time display as oppose to the recorded
> ones that everyon=
e had seen on the ARK.
> 
> Of course the thick canopy of trees was shown, =
one that was so thick
> that even infrared and other image enhancers could =
not truly pierce
> its shell. However what it did pick up was an energy dis=
tortion field
> composed at least partially of Unicronian energies. It was =
this field
> that seemed to be what was blocking communications and sensor =
probes.
> The field was perhaps one hundred miles or so in diameter and app=
eared
> to be centered in a section of exposed caves about 50 miles from on=
e
> edge of the jungle.
> 
> Interestingly the field was beginning to flick=
er as if it were
> becoming unstable, although there was no obvious reason =
for it.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 


--Apple-Mail-A44AD1B0-D1F7-42C4-94C7-3B9F6BAC4AEA

t;<br>

"Acknowledged.' The computer said. "Cheetor's identification pr=
ofile<br>
has been suspended."<br>
<br>
Meanwhile on one of the display pan=
els the jungle was displayed,<br>
however this time it was a real time disp=
lay as oppose to the recorded<br>
ones that everyone had seen on the ARK.<b=
r>
<br>
Of course the thick canopy of trees was shown, one that was so thic=
k<br>
that even infrared and other image enhancers could not truly pierce<b=
r>
its shell. However what it did pick up was an energy distortion field<br=
>
composed at least partially of Unicronian energies. It was this field<br>=

that seemed to be what was blocking communications and sensor probes.<br>
=
The field was perhaps one hundred miles or so in diameter and appeared<br>
=
to be centered in a section of exposed caves about 50 miles from one<br>
ed=
ge of the jungle.<br>
<br>
Interestingly the field was beginning to flicker=
 as if it were<br>
becoming unstable, although there was no obvious reason =
for it.<br>
